Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
expand = fix expand (p : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : nat := match l with | nil => 0 | x :: l0 => x + p * expand p l0 end : nat -> list nat -> nat Arguments expand _%nat_scope _%list_scope
prime_decomp : forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> {l : list nat | n = fold_right Init.Nat.mul 1 l /\ Forall prime l}
expand_app : forall (p : nat) (l m : list nat), expand p (l ++ m) = expand p l + power (length l) p * expand p m
prime_or_div : forall p : nat, 2 <= p -> {q : nat | 2 <= q < p /\ divides q p} + {prime p}
prime_factor : forall n : nat, 2 <= n -> {p : nat | prime p /\ divides p n}
VectorDef.take : forall p0 : nat, p0 <= ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A ?n -> VectorDef.t ?A p0 where ?A : [p : nat Hp : 2 <= p n : nat |- Type] ?n : [p : nat Hp : 2 <= p n : nat |- nat]
expand_0 : forall (p : nat) (l : list nat), Forall (eq 0) l -> expand p l = 0
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
list_split_length : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k <= length ll -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ length l = k}}
prime_ge_2 : forall p : nat, prime p -> 2 <= p
prime_bool_rec_spec : forall n p : nat, n <= p -> prime_bool_rec n p = true < -> (forall k : nat, 3 <= n - 2 * k -> ~ divides (n - 2 * k) p)
power_ge_n : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> k <= power k p
div_by_p_lt : forall p n : nat, 2 <= p -> n <> 0 -> div n p < n
destruct_list : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), {x : A & {tl : list A | l = x :: tl}} + {l = nil}
divides_bool = fun n p : nat => match p mod n with | 0 => true | S _ => false end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments divides_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
power_sinc : forall k p : nat, 2 <= p -> power k p < power (S k) p
Nat.log2_iter_spec : forall k p q r : nat, 2 ^ S p = q + S r -> r < 2 ^ p -> let s := Nat.log2_iter k p q r in 2 ^ s <= k + q < 2 ^ S s
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
list_pick : forall (X : Type) (ll : list X) (k : nat), k < length ll -> {x : X & {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ length l = k}}}
power_smono_l : forall p q x : nat, 2 <= x -> p < q -> power p x < power q x
msum_first_two : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> X -> X) (u : X), monoid_theory m u -> forall (n : nat) (f : nat -> X), 2 <= n -> (forall i : nat, 2 <= i -> f i = u) -> msum m u n f = m (f 0) (f 1)
divides_dec : forall q p : nat, {k : nat | q = k * p} + {~ divides p q}
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.log2_spec : forall n : nat, 0 < n -> 2 ^ Nat.log2 n <= n < 2 ^ S (Nat.log2 n)
prime_bool_rec = fix prime_bool_rec (n p : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | S (S (S _ as n')) => negb (divides_bool n p) && prime_bool_rec n' p | _ => true end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments prime_bool_rec (_ _)%nat_scope
map_cons_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (y : Y) (m : list Y), map f ll = y :: m -> {x : X & {l : list X | ll = x :: l /\ f x = y /\ map f l = m}}

map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
Nat.le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n <= m -> m <= p -> n <= p
Nat.log2_unique : forall a b : nat, 0 <= b -> 2 ^ b <= a < 2 ^ S b -> Nat.log2 a = b

Nat.add_le_mono_r : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> n + p <= m + p
Nat.add_le_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n <= m < -> p + n <= p + m

mult_le_compat : forall n m p q : nat, n <= m -> p <= q -> n * p <= m * q
